info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 1 at 2:19AM CDT until May 2 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Norman OK
info.description:
...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Oklahoma...
North Canadian River near Wetumka affecting Hughes County.
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...North Canadian River near Wetumka.
* WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight.
* IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Shallow flooding affects rural lands... local roads... and oil wells in Seminole... Okfuskee... Hughes... and McIntosh counties... upstream from Lake Eufaula. Livestock and property should be relocated to places which are higher than nearby river banks to avoid being isolated by deep water in side channels crossing the flood plain.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 18.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 21.0 feet. - Forecast...The North Canadian River is expected to rise to a crest of 22.0 feet this afternoon. - Action stage is 22.0 feet. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT
